taxon_name.authority: Rydberg in N. L. Britton et al.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe peritylinae;genus perityle;section laphamia;species bisetosa

bio:treatment.description: Plants 2–7(–10) cm. Leaves usually opposite; petioles 0–2 mm; blades ovate or ovate-lanceolate to lanceolate, margins entire or subserrate, faces glabrate; pappi of 2 bristles. 2n = 34.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety bisetosa appears to be restricted to a relatively small area in extreme southern Pecos County and adjacent Brewster County.
